title: Domain 3.5: Given a scenario, troubleshoot common mobile OS and application security issues.
content:
🛡️ Security Concerns

  • Android Package (APK) Source: 📦 Installing APKs from unknown sources can introduce malware. Stick to official app stores.
  • Developer Mode: 👨‍💻 Enables deeper access for testing, but if left on, it weakens system protections.
  • Root Access / Jailbreak: 🔓 Grants full control of the OS, but bypasses security features and increases vulnerability.
  • Bootleg / Malicious Applications: ⚠️ Counterfeit apps may carry spyware or trojans. Only download from trusted sources.
  • Application Spoofing: 🎭 Fake apps mimic real ones to deceive users into installing malicious software.

🚨 Common Symptoms

  • High Network Traffic: 📶 Could indicate malware sending data or adware pulling ads constantly.
  • Sluggish Response Time: 🐢 Rogue apps or malware draining CPU/RAM in the background.
  • Data-Usage Limit Notification: 📊 Suspicious spikes in usage may be caused by spyware or data-leaking apps.
  • Limited / No Internet Connectivity: 🌐 Malware might be interfering with DNS settings or blocking access.
  • High Number of Ads: 📺 Adware displays persistent pop-ups, banners, or notification spam.
  • Fake Security Warnings: 🚫 Scare tactics used to prompt downloading of malicious 'cleaners' or apps.
  • Unexpected Application Behavior: 🤖 Apps launching randomly or changes to device settings without input.
  • Leaked Personal Files / Data: 🧾 Signs your data has been accessed or shared without permission — major red flag for compromise.
